answers.answer: How many weeks are you? I would at least go get checked out just in case. Better safe than sorry.
How many weeks are you? I would at least go get checked out just in case. Better safe than sorry.
I also agree that you should be checked.

I always get dizzy & feel super weak during my pregnancies. I'm feeling like that today actually :( i pass out a lot too. It's not a stomach bug girl. Your midwife is completely wrong. It's your blood sugar level. Even if you passed your glucose test & don't have diabetes your blood level fluctuates very quickly during pregnancy so you have to eat. After I eat I always feel better. Drink some fruit juice because it has sugar & is more healthy than sodas or koolaid. & eat something like a salad with boiled eggs chopped in it if you find it hard to eat anything. I know when I get like that I lose my appetite & only eat in small portions.
Yes go to hospital. ... it might be Braxton hicks contractions but better safe than sorry

question: Last night I was sick and dizzy I got the fiancé to phone the midwife as I didn't have no energy to move from the toilet! She said it's just a stomach bug but today my whole stomach is really tight feels like one big massive stitch it's a challenge for me to move, lay down and take deep breaths . A lot of people said it's early labour?  But I'm not sure.
title: help!
